member.name: T:Hardware.Info.Battery
member.summary: WMI class: Win32_Battery

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.FullChargeCapacity
member.summary: Full charge capacity of the battery in milliwatt-hours. Comparison of the value to the DesignCapacity property determines when the battery requires replacement. A battery's end of life is typically when the FullChargeCapacity property falls below 80% of the DesignCapacity property.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.DesignCapacity
member.summary: Design capacity of the battery in milliwatt-hours.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.BatteryStatus
member.summary: Status of the battery.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.EstimatedChargeRemaining
member.summary: Estimate of the percentage of full charge remaining

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.EstimatedRunTime
member.summary: Estimate in minutes of the time to battery charge depletion under the present load conditions if the utility power is off, or lost and remains off, or a laptop is disconnected from a power source.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.ExpectedLife
member.summary: Battery's expected lifetime in minutes, assuming that the battery is fully charged. The property represents the total expected life of the battery, not its current remaining life, which is indicated by the EstimatedRunTime property.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.MaxRechargeTime
member.summary: Maximum time, in minutes, to fully charge the battery. The property represents the time to recharge a fully depleted battery, not the current remaining charge time, which is indicated in the TimeToFullCharge property.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.TimeOnBattery
member.summary: Elapsed time in seconds since the computer system's UPS last switched to battery power, or the time since the system or UPS was last restarted, whichever is less. If the battery is "on line", 0 (zero) is returned.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.TimeToFullCharge
member.summary: Remaining time to charge the battery fully in minutes at the current charging rate and usage.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Battery.BatteryStatusDescription
member.summary: Battery status description

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.Battery.ToString
member.summary: Write all property values to a string
member.returns: Each property on a new line

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.BIOS.ReleaseDate
member.summary: Release date of the Windows BIOS in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format of YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.MMMMMM(+-)OOO.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.BIOS.SerialNumber
member.summary: Assigned serial number of the software element.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.BIOS.SoftwareElementID
member.summary: Identifier for this software element; designed to be used in conjunction with other keys to create a unique representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.BIOS.Version
member.summary: Version of the BIOS. This string is created by the BIOS manufacturer.

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.BIOS.ToString

member.name: T:Hardware.Info.CPU
member.summary: WMI class: Win32_Processor

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.Caption
member.summary: Short description of an object (a one-line string).

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.CurrentClockSpeed
member.summary: Current speed of the processor, in MHz.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.Description
member.summary: Description of the object.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.L1InstructionCacheSize
member.summary: Size of the Level 1 processor instruction cache. A Level 1 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.L1DataCacheSize
member.summary: Size of the Level 1 processor data cache. A Level 1 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.L2CacheSize
member.summary: Size of the Level 2 processor cache. A Level 2 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.L3CacheSize
member.summary: Size of the Level 3 processor cache. A Level 3 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the processor manufacturer.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.MaxClockSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed of the processor, in MHz.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.NumberOfCores
member.summary: Number of cores for the current instance of the processor. A core is a physical processor on the integrated circuit. For example, in a dual-core processor this property has a value of 2.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.NumberOfLogicalProcessors
member.summary: Number of logical processors for the current instance of the processor. For processors capable of hyperthreading, this value includes only the processors which have hyperthreading enabled.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.ProcessorId
member.summary: Processor information that describes the processor features. For an x86 class CPU, the field format depends on the processor support of the CPUID instruction. If the instruction is supported, the property contains 2 (two) DWORD formatted values. The first is an offset of 08h-0Bh, which is the EAX value that a CPUID instruction returns with input EAX set to 1. The second is an offset of 0Ch-0Fh, which is the EDX value that the instruction returns. Only the first two bytes of the property are significant and contain the contents of the DX register at CPU resetâ€”all others are set to 0 (zero), and the contents are in DWORD format.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.SecondLevelAddressTranslationExtensions
member.summary: If True, the processor supports address translation extensions used for virtualization.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.SocketDesignation
member.summary: Type of chip socket used on the circuit.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.VirtualizationFirmwareEnabled
member.summary: If True, the Firmware has enabled virtualization extensions.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.VMMonitorModeExtensions
member.summary: If True, the processor supports Intel or AMD Virtual Machine Monitor extensions.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.PercentProcessorTime
member.summary: % Processor Time is the percentage of elapsed time that the processor spends to execute a non-Idle thread. It is calculated by measuring the percentage of time that the processor spends executing the idle thread and then subtracting that value from 100%. (Each processor has an idle thread that consumes cycles when no other threads are ready to run). This counter is the primary indicator of processor activity, and displays the average percentage of busy time observed during the sample interval. It should be noted that the accounting calculation of whether the processor is idle is performed at an internal sampling interval of the system clock (10ms). On todays fast processors, % Processor Time can therefore underestimate the processor utilization as the processor may be spending a lot of time servicing threads between the system clock sampling interval. Workload based timer applications are one example of applications which are more likely to be measured inaccurately as timers are signaled just after the sample is taken.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CPU.CpuCoreList
member.summary: List of

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.CPU.ToString
member.summary: Write all property values to a string
member.returns: Each property on a new line

member.name: T:Hardware.Info.CpuCore
member.summary: WMI class: Win32_PerfFormattedData_PerfOS_Processor

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CpuCore.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.CpuCore.PercentProcessorTime
member.summary: % Processor Time is the percentage of elapsed time that the processor spends to execute a non-Idle thread. It is calculated by measuring the percentage of time that the processor spends executing the idle thread and then subtracting that value from 100%. (Each processor has an idle thread that consumes cycles when no other threads are ready to run). This counter is the primary indicator of processor activity, and displays the average percentage of busy time observed during the sample interval. It should be noted that the accounting calculation of whether the processor is idle is performed at an internal sampling interval of the system clock (10ms). On todays fast processors, % Processor Time can therefore underestimate the processor utilization as the processor may be spending a lot of time servicing threads between the system clock sampling interval. Workload based timer applications are one example of applications which are more likely to be measured inaccurately as timers are signaled just after the sample is taken.

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.CpuCore.ToString
member.summary: Write all property values to a string
member.returns: Each property on a new line

member.name: T:Hardware.Info.FormFactor
member.summary: Implementation form factor for the chip.

member.summary: Represents an unknown or unspecified form factor.

member.summary: Represents a form factor that is categorized as "OTHER," not falling into specific predefined categories.

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.SIP
member.summary: Represents a Single In-line Package (SIP) form factor.

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.DIP
member.summary: Represents a Dual In-line Package (DIP) form factor.

member.summary: Represents a Zigzag In-line Package (ZIP) form factor.

member.summary: Represents a Small Outline J-lead (SOJ) form factor.

member.summary: Represents a form factor that is proprietary and not covered by other specific categories.

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.SIMM
member.summary: Represents a Single Inline Memory Module (SIMM) form factor.

member.summary: Represents a Dual Inline Memory Module (DIMM) form factor.

member.summary: Represents a Thin Small Outline Package (TSOP) form factor.

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.PGA
member.summary: Represents a Pin Grid Array (PGA) form factor.

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.RIMM
member.summary: Represents a Rambus Inline Memory Module (RIMM) form factor.

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.SODIMM
member.summary: Represents a Small Outline Dual In-line Memory Module (SODIMM) form factor.

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.SRIMM

member.name: F:Hardware.Info.FormFactor.SMD

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.BankLabel
member.summary: Physically labeled bank where the memory is located.

member.summary: Total capacity of the physical memory in bytes.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.FormFactor
member.summary: Implementation form factor for the chip.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.MaxVoltage
member.summary: The maximum operating voltage for this device, in millivolts, or 0, if the voltage is unknown.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.MinVoltage
member.summary: The minimum operating voltage for this device, in millivolts, or 0, if the voltage is unknown.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.PartNumber
member.summary: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.SerialNumber
member.summary: Manufacturer-allocated number to identify the physical element.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.Memory.Speed
member.summary: Speed of the physical memory in nanoseconds.

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.Memory.ToString
member.summary: Write all property values to a string
member.returns: Each property on a new line

member.name: T:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus
member.summary: Memory status

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.TotalPhysical
member.summary: The amount of actual physical memory, in bytes.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.AvailablePhysical
member.summary: The amount of physical memory currently available, in bytes. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.TotalPageFile
member.summary: The current committed memory limit for the system or the current process, whichever is smaller, in bytes.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.AvailablePageFile
member.summary: The maximum amount of memory the current process can commit, in bytes. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.TotalVirtual
member.summary: The size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process, in bytes. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.AvailableVirtual
member.summary: The amount of unreserved and uncommitted memory currently in the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process, in bytes.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.AvailableExtendedVirtual
member.summary: Reserved. This value is always 0.

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.MemoryStatus.ToString
member.summary: Write all property values to a string
member.returns: Each property on a new line

member.summary: Network medium in use.

member.summary: Description of the object.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.MACAddress
member.summary: Media access control address for this network adapter. A MAC address is a unique 48-bit number assigned to the network adapter by the manufacturer. It uniquely identifies this network adapter and is used for mapping TCP/IP network communications.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the network adapter's manufacturer.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.NetConnectionID
member.summary: Name of the network connection.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.ProductName
member.summary: Product name of the network adapter.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.Speed
member.summary: Estimate of the current bandwidth in bits per second.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.BytesSentPersec
member.summary: Bytes Sent/sec is the rate at which bytes are sent over each network adapter, including framing characters.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.BytesReceivedPersec
member.summary: Bytes Received/sec is the rate at which bytes are received over each network adapter, including framing characters.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.DefaultIPGatewayList
member.summary: Array of IP addresses of default gateways that the computer system uses.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.DHCPServer
member.summary: IP address of the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.DNSServerSearchOrderList
member.summary: Array of server IP addresses to be used in querying for DNS servers.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.IPAddressList
member.summary: Array of all of the IP addresses associated with the current network adapter. This property can contain either IPv6 addresses or IPv4 addresses.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.NetworkAdapter.IPSubnetList
member.summary: Array of all of the subnet masks associated with the current network adapter.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.AdapterRAM
member.summary: Memory size of the video adapter.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.Caption
member.summary: Short description of the object.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.CurrentBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits used to display each pixel.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.CurrentHorizontalResolution
member.summary: Current number of horizontal pixels.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.CurrentNumberOfColors
member.summary: Number of colors supported at the current resolution.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.CurrentRefreshRate
member.summary: Frequency at which the video controller refreshes the image for the monitor. A value of 0 (zero) indicates the default rate is being used, while 0xFFFFFFFF indicates the optimal rate is being used.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.CurrentVerticalResolution
member.summary: Current number of vertical pixels.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.Description
member.summary: Description of the object.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.DriverDate
member.summary: Last modification date and time of the currently installed video driver.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.DriverVersion
member.summary: Version number of the video driver.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.Manufacturer
member.summary: Manufacturer of the video controller.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.MaxRefreshRate
member.summary: Maximum refresh rate of the video controller in hertz.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.MinRefreshRate
member.summary: Minimum refresh rate of the video controller in hertz.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.VideoModeDescription
member.summary: Current resolution, color, and scan mode settings of the video controller.

member.name: P:Hardware.Info.VideoController.VideoProcessor
member.summary: Free-form string describing the video processor.

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.VideoController.ToString
member.summary: Write all property values to a string
member.returns: Each property on a new line

member.name: M:Hardware.Info.HardwareInfo.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Main Hardware.Info class
member.param: causes WMI queries to use SELECT * FROM instead of SELECT with a list of property names
sets the Timeout property of the EnumerationOptions in the ManagementObjectSearcher that executes the query. The default value is EnumerationOptions.InfiniteTimeout
